headline: Oven-Baked Potato Slices
description: These sliced baked potatoes are seasoned with a flavorful spice blend, drizzled with olive oil, and baked to crispy perfection for an easy side dish.

video.description: I created this recipe by accident. After already starting dinner one night I realized I didn't have enough potatoes on hand to make mashed, so I improvised and came up with these baked potato slices. It's quick and easy and they are delicious.
video.name: How to Make Oven-Baked Potato Slices

name: Oven-Baked Potato Slices
recipeIngredient: 4 tablespoons olive oil, or more as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Place potatoes, garlic powder, black pepper, celery seed, paprika, cayenne pepper, and salt into a zip-top bag. Shake to coat evenly.
Pour the entire contents of the bag onto a large baking sheet and spread evenly. Drizzle with olive oil.
Bake in the preheated oven until potatoes reach desired crispness, turning frequently to brown evenly, 40 to 45 minutes.
Remove from the oven. Let cool slightly and transfer into a serving dish.

review.reviewBody: They were very crisp and cooked all the way through. I just experimented with one potato. 400 degrees and 40 minutes, just about 5 minutes too long I think because of how thin they were. I actually got chips. I surprised myself by getting them sliced so thinly. But the larger pieces had soft and chewy centers, and I did enjoy them. I turned them twice to keep them from burning; by the second turn they were almost done. Next time I will do about 30 minutes, 400 and a bit less oil so they don't fry so much. Yummy snack though. gone in minutes.
Lol… cooked for 20 min and way overcooked. I highly do not recommend this recipe.

I made these along with the baked crispy and tender chicken thighs also found here. I used the spice mix from the chicken recipe on these as well (which is nearly the same as spices used on this recipe). I cut the slices about 1/4" thick..sprinkled olive oil on the taters and then put the seasoning on top of that. Baked for about an hour or so. Amazing!!!! Will make these again and again!!
Great. Missed the. Grease a little but they were good
Great recipe for potato chips. I doubled it and used 3 potatoes. I didn't have any celery seeds, but used onion powder and they came out very well.
These are always good. My mother made them all the time for us 30 years ago.

They were tasty, but I had lots of problems with this recipe: I first tried the shaker bag options and just wasn't getting a good coating and four potatoes requires doing this over and over again because that is a lot of potato for one food storage bag. So then I switched to laying them on the foiled baking sheet before sprinkling with seasoning and oil. Well the potatoes stuck something fierce - what a mess.

I wanted to do something different so I tried this. They still feel a little hard like they’re not cooked. Maybe next time I try it I’ll need to put a little bit of water in the pan instead of oil. There was one ingredient that I didn’t have so I just used the others. Any suggestions for this would be great.

This was an easy to prepare recipe, and I made as directed with two exceptions, I doubled the celery seed and also used a convection oven (con convection roast), which cut the time to 30 minutes. A tasty side dish to serve with any main dish. Thanks for the recipe!
Easy and better than frying them
These potatoes were excellent! Nothing else to say.

Made as written and at 45 minutes I ended up with oven baked potato chips that were crispy and full of flavor. While not a side dish as I had intended them to be, they were excellent actually. If you are looking for a side dish to go with a dinner I recommend reducing the cook time so that you don't end up with chips. For me, I will let them go 45 minutes and use this recipe to make potato chips because they were that good.
